page.title: 01Introduction to Codsall
page.content: The survey area is mainly rural,with built up areas concentrated in the SE round Codsall. The first mention of Codsall is in the Domesday Book which shows that it consisted of 3 hides held by Chenvin,with land for three ploughs. Today, the parish of Codsall,lying on the boundary of its own county,Stafford shire and close to those of Shropshire and the West Midlands, has become a popular residential area, mainly for people working in Wolverhampton.Codsall with an estimated population of 13,000 lies about 4 miles north west of this large industrial town and is only just separated from it by a very narrow green belt. Thus, although the village is still partly rural, suburban W'ton appears to be gaining ground. Codsall is now something of an administrative centre, housing the offices of the South Staffordshire District Council.
